title: Spanish elections: Catalonia holds the key
description: In the unlikely scenario that the separatists of the Junts party abstain from the confirmation vote, the left could remain in power.

title: Biden administration sues Texas governor over Rio Grande barrier meant to stop migrants
description: The lawsuit asks a court to force Texas to remove a 1,000-foot line of bright orange, wrecking ball-sized buoys that the administration says raises humanitarian and environmental concerns.

title: Dungeons & Dragons: From a midwestern town to a global role-playing sensation
description: 'Dungeons & Dragons: The saga of a game' (1/6). The very first role-playing game was created in the early 1970s by Gary Gygax, a war game enthusiast with a passion for science fiction and heroic fantasy.

title: Spanish elections: Alberto Nuñez Feijoo's bittersweet victory
description: Although the People's Party came out on top in the election, with 3 million more votes than in the 2019 poll, the right-wing leader doesn't seem to be in a position to build a government coalition.

title: Paris 2024: LVMH named as premium Olympics' sponsor
description: The luxury group becomes the sixth premium partner for the sporting event, which launches in exactly one year from Wednesday.

title: Saudi Arabian football team Al-Hilal makes record €300 million bid for top PSG striker Mbappé
description: Mbappé had declared in May that he would not extend his PSG contract, which expires next year, but indicated he wanted to remain at the club for a final season.

title: Looking for Roman Abramovich, the human chameleon
description: 'Roman Abramovich, the most secretive of oligarchs' (1/6). Le Monde traced the career of this mysterious and elusive businessman. From the world of oil to the Kremlin's corridors, from London to Ukraine, he embodies post-Soviet Russia and the Putin years.

title: Macron calls for 'order, order, order' after French riots
description: Speaking on French television during a trip to New Caledonia, Macron pleaded for a return to authority 'at every level' after the shooting of a teenager by a police officer sparked the biggest urban riots in the country since 2005.

title: Israel's parliament approve controversial judicial reform clause
description: The bill only passed after all members of the opposition stormed out of the chamber on Monday.

title: French stars pay final farewell to Jane Birkin
description: The British-born artist, famous in France after collaborating with French pop icon Serge Gainsbourg, died on July 16.

title: Greta Thunberg fined for disobeying Sweden police, denies crime
description: The Swedish environmental activist said she acted out of necessity during the rally, when protestors tried to block the entrance and exit to the Malmo harbor.

title: Israel: Netanyahu out of hospital and in parliament for key vote
description: The Knesset is holding the final vote on a judicial overhaul that would weaken judges' powers and give the government a greater say in their appointments.

title: With no clear winner, Spanish elections once again highlight the country's deep divisions
description: PM Pedro Sanchez and his right-wing rival Alberto Nunez Feijoo each began negotiations Monday to try to head off a fresh vote after an inconclusive snap election resulted in a hung parliament.

title: French designer Agnès B.: 'Artistic emotion is very close to spiritual emotion'
description: In 'Le Langage du corps' ('Body Language'), the designer presents a selection of works from her collection at La Fab. in Paris. She talked to Le Monde about her relationship with art and artists.

title: In a Lyon working-class suburb, residents face brunt of climate change: 'During heatwaves, it's an oven'
description: The apartment blocks built in the 1960s are no longer adapted to climate change. The residents of Les Sapins envy those of Caravelle, a similar residence that has recently been renovated.

title: Macron visits New Caledonia to push agreement on territory's future
description: After five years, the French president is back in the archipelago, which is still on the path to self-determination, as part of a trip to Oceania.

title: Affluent families in a Lyon suburb flee the city's heat to the countryside
description: The chic western suburb of Charbonnières-les-Bains in Lyon, a 15-minute tram ride from the heart of the city, is suffering from climate change but remains a haven of greenery.

title: French police chiefs call for detained officer to be freed, angering left
description: A police officer in Marseille was remanded in custody after being charged over the beating of a man during recent riots. 'Knowing that he is in prison is stopping me from sleeping,' said France's national police chief said.

title: How Lyon is adapting as France's most exposed city to rising temperatures
description: According to projections by climatologists and meteorologists, Lyon's climate could resemble Madrid's by 2050 and Algiers' by the end of the century, minus the sea.

title: 15 dead, 19 missing after Indonesia ferry capsizes
description: Six people were rescued and taken to hospital for treatment, and the cause of the sinking was being investigated.

title: How Louboutin fought tooth and nail for his special red
description: Courts sometimes have to rule on creative disputes, such as the time world-famous luxury shoemaker Christian Louboutin became the center of a series of legal tangles over his famous scarlet soles.

title: Russia says two Ukrainian drones 'crashed' in Moscow
description: Russia said on Monday it had 'suppressed' two Ukrainian drones in Moscow, accusing Kyiv of launching a 'terrorist act' on the Russian capital.

title: Israel in turmoil on eve of vote on judicial reform
description: Tens of thousands of demonstrators from Tel Aviv and the coastal plain marched into Jerusalem on Sunday, as defections of reservists multiply and weaken the armed forces.

title: Champagne expects a slight erosion in sales in 2023
description: At a meeting on Wednesday, champagne producers and houses set the yield at 11,400 kg per hectare. This is a higher yield than sales forecasts, which takes into account the drop in purchasing power.
